snippet.title: 'Star Wars' and 'Doctor Who' fans in altercation at sci-fi convention
snippet.description: Police are called to a sci-fi convention in the U.K. after fans of "Doctor Who" -- allegedly uninvited -- enter the convention, to the displeasure of certain forceful "Star Wars" fans.

snippet.title: Live on Google+: The 2012 Republican National Convention
snippet.description: Organizers say new technology will offer "virtual front-row seat" to convention proceedings in Tampa.

snippet.title: Inaugural Call of Duty XP convention deploys in LA
snippet.description: Activision gathers thousands of fans on the west side of Los Angeles for a weekend celebration of Call of Duty that includes an unveiling of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3.

snippet.title: Call of Duty convention deploys Sept. 2-3
snippet.description: Modern Warfare 3 multiplayer to get world premiere as 6,000 fans of blockbuster military shooter series are expected to descend on Los Angeles for Call of Duty XP 2011.

snippet.title: SXSWi: Emergency alarm evacuates convention center
snippet.description: Was it a glitch or a mischievous prankster who pulled the fire alarm during the South by Southwest Interactive Festival? Or maybe a sign that it's happy hour?

snippet.title: Technology lobbyists gather at Republican convention
snippet.description: Representatives of the technology industry in town for the Republican convention could be found Wednesday at Chambers, a self-described luxury art hotel.

snippet.title: Unconventional convention coverage via Google
snippet.description: At the Democratic convention, its YouTube expects to make Webcasts of all of speeches, and staffers will be available to help people upload video, photographs, and blogs.

snippet.title: How the Democratic convention is getting wired
snippet.description: Qwest, Cisco Systems, Symantec, and others are providing the technical infrastructure for the Democrats this week in Denver at one of the most tech-heavy political conventions ever.

snippet.title: Nokia N95: The ultimate convention swag
snippet.description: What better prize could a CNET cell phone apps editor ask for than a Nokia N95? Hmm, how about the N96?
